channel.title: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
channel.description: Im trying to install Wickr I install snap restart then install it with snap and during the installation, it switches to live mode, and I've tried restarting made sure im not booting into live mode. is there any way to force it to boot into persistent mode?

item.title: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
item.dc:creator: Cottonwoodhill
item.description:
hi sheep

Are you able to install Wickr me using :

sudo snap install authy --beta

Is that a kind of store?

Thanks for your reply.

Read full topic
item.source: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode

item.title: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
Same thing happened to me but with authy, installed using snapd.

sudo apt install snapd
sudo snap install authy --beta

Snapcraft

Install Twilio Authy on Debian using the Snap Store | Snapcraft

Get the latest version of Twilio Authy for on Debian - 2-Factor Authentication

Live indicator is there (I didn’t choose live mode), and I do however see that changes are written to disk and persist from one boot to another.

Read full topic

item.title: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Confirmed.

This will be fixed in next version.

GitLab

live mod indicator: fix false positive live mode detection (d9b12efe) ·...

when installing snapd Thanks to DooSkagg for the bug report! https://forums.whonix.org/t/wickr-me-gets-whonix-stuck-in-live-mode/9834

Read full topic
item.source: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode

item.title: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
DooSkagg via Whonix Forum:

Im trying to install Wickr I install snap restart then install it with snap and during the installation, it switches to live mode,

This is not possible. Or even if it was possible in theory… At very
least at time of writing switching from persistent to live mode without
reboot is unsupported.

What live indicator says can be safely ignored if you know what you are
doing. (Know you’re in which mode.)

snapd uses mount. This might confuse live mode indicator.

gitlab.com

whonix/whonix-xfce-desktop-config/-/blob/master/usr/share/livecheck/livecheck.sh

I’ll try to re-produce.

and I’ve tried restarting made sure im not booting into live mode. is there any way to force it to boot into persistent mode?

Therefore not possible / not needed.

Read full topic
item.source: Wickr Me gets Whonix stuck in live mode
